description:
This file implements the core functions of a SLAP (Service Logic Aggregation Plane) server component, specifically for handling dispatching of IMCP-based SLAP calls via an LPC connector. It defines functions for dispatching calls, freeing output buffers, and handling events related to the server object.

Core functions include:
- SlapLsoCpcCallDispatch: Handles incoming calls based on their type and delegates to specific processing functions.
- SlapLsoCpcFreeOutputBuffer: Frees allocated output buffers.
- SlapLsoCpcNotifyEvent: Handles or propagates events.

It is crucial in the communication framework of the SLAP environment, managing different types of calls and ensuring proper memory management and event handling.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLsoCpcCallDispatch(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hLpcPartyAddr,void * pInputBuffer,ULONG ulInputSize,void ** ppOutputBuffer,PULONG pulOutputSize,PULONG pulErrorCode)
methods.description: Dispatches an IMCP-based SLAP call received over LPC, delegating to various processing functions based on call type.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLsoCpcFreeOutputBuffer(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,void * pOutputBuffer)
methods.description: Frees the memory allocated for the output buffer of a dispatched call.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLsoCpcNotifyEvent(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ULONG ulEvent,ANSC_HANDLE hReserved)
methods.description: Handles or propagates LPC events; currently a no-op.

ctags.name: SlapLsoCpcCallDispatch
ctags.signature: (ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hLpcPartyAddr,void * pInputBuffer,ULONG ulInputSize,void ** ppOutputBuffer,PULONG pulOutputSize,PULONG pulErrorCode)
